Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2009 06:55PM mbscruggs wrote: It happened to me last night!!  Was talking to 2 male friends, too     Told them to not be surprised if I just whip my shirt up and show 'em the new boob I am growing!  Try not to take the stares personally.  People really do not always know the right things to say or do.  I have found myself talking light heartedly about it, just to break the seriousness.  Almost too light hearted, sometimes.  I don't want to make anyone uncomfortable, but I  need to remember that this is deadly and serious- but I try to keep things light.

Posts.Content: mbscruggs wrote: Ok- am on tamoxifen.  I had a TE put in on Monday.  Things seem to be progressing normal.  On Keflex for three days (finished Thurs. morning).  Dr. reccomended starting motrin Thursday (inlieuof percocet, I guess).  I woke up three times last night, with a warm flush feeling, that lasted about 4 minutes each time.  Prior to that, any hot flashes (if that is what I am having) only lasted 1 minute of so, once or twice a day.  I feel a little warm, but no fever.  The TE boob looks normal....Scared of infection. Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2009 07:55PM mbscruggs wrote: You will start getting accustomed to them, I promise!!!  Until then, remember that you are still healing from the surgery.  Are you able to get up and about, walk around?  I felt better if I moved alittle.  I also tried slow, deep breaths to calm down. Oh, and doing the exercises (wall walk with fingers) when allowed.  I imagine you could get an rx for an anxiety med.  I started taking an antidepressant when diagnosed but it made me a little jittery and took about 3 weeks to kick in.  I went off it after my mastectomy.  I had my expander placed 3 months after my mastectomy, so I was somewhat healed by then from the mx, but it did take me 2 weeks to feel "normal" or atleast where I didn't think about it for stretches at a time.
